reporter_caption.center: KIRKSVILLE MANOR v. DEPT., SOCIAL SERV., 875 S.W.2d 915 (Mo.App.W.D. 1994)

caption.center: KIRKSVILLE MANOR, INC., d/b/a KIRKSVILLE MANOR CARE CENTER, RESPONDENT, v.
MISSOURI DEPARTMENT OF SOCIAL SERVICES, DIVISION OF MEDICAL SERVICES,

court.center: Missouri Court of Appeals, Western District.

date.center: Motion for Rehearing and/or Transfer to Supreme Court Denied May 31, 1994.

opinion.posture: APPEAL FROM THE CIRCUIT COURT OF ADAIR COUNTY; R. BRUCE NORMILE, JUDGE.
opinion.attorneys:
Melanie Wilmes, Mo. Dept. of Social Services, Div. of Legal Services, Jefferson City, for appellant.
Harvey Tettlebaum, Jefferson City, for respondent.
opinion.panel: Before HANNA, P.J., and BRECKENRIDGE and ELLIS, JJ.
opinion.opinion_text: [1] Appeal from the Circuit Court of Adair County, Missouri, reversing the Administrative Hearing Commission denying a rate increase to respondent. The circuit court's decision is affirmed. Rule 84.16(b).
